intro: Verbesina rivetii, commonly known as the yellow beggar-ticks, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Verbesina rivetii is often found in moist, disturbed soils along roadsides and in wetlands.
